page.title: 08Employment
page.content: The biggest single employer of people in the area is farming.Even when people have taken other jobs they often do so reluctantly and because they have been unable to raise the capital for their own land.The idea of dividing up large farms into smaller units rented out by the council, as happened at Manor Farm just after World War I, seems very popular, but there are not enough of these to go round.Often families take a plot of 2 or 3 acres to work on part time and take another full time job.Some of them have been farm workers but as rents,rates and wages have risen, they have been increasingly replaced by machines.At busy times farmers make up their work force with their parents,grandparents,cousins and friends.
